page.title: 04FINANCE
page.content: There are several financial institutions in Thornhill. These have grown up to serve Thornhill and its surrounding areas. The oldest institution is the Trustee Savings Bank (TSB) which was established in 1842. This is a part time sub-branch of Britain's oldest TSB in Dumfries. The main bank is a main branch of the Bank of Scotland. The only full building society is the National Provincial, which opened in 1983. It is a sub-branch of the main branch in Dumfries. The two solicitors in the village:- Robert Wilson and son and W M Henderson act as agents for building societies. These are the Leicester and Nationwide respectively. Finally there is a Post Office which was established in 1850, originally it was a crown Post Office but now it is a sub-branch.
